According to Uvarov ( 1943 ) it is characterized by larger size than the nominate taxon and yellow hind tibiae and edges of inner hind femurs. As above reported, specimens of Middle East resulted to be of smaller size than those of North Africa. I may confirm only the character of the hind legs, that however has been detected also in some North African specimens. Thus, also considering the high variability of
T. pulchripennis
, I believe that it is unjustified the taxonomic division of this taxon into subspecies.
